title: How to Say Love in Thai

steps.title: Look at love from the differences of view based on the person's sex.
steps.content: Look at love from the differences of view based on the person's sex. From a man: Phom (I - masculine) Rak (love) Khun (you). [1] X Research source From a woman: Chan (I - feminine) Rak Khun. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Define beautifulness.
steps.content: Define beautifulness. You are beautiful: Khun su-ay (beautiful) mak (very). [3] X Research source

steps.title: Define cuteness.
steps.content: Define cuteness. You are cute: Khun narak (cute) / Khun narak mak. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tell someone that you miss them.
steps.content: Tell someone that you miss them. I miss you: Phom/Chan Khit-Theung (miss) Khun. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Add some politeness.
steps.content: Add some politeness. (Adding "Khrap" for a man, "Kha" for a woman, makes any statement very polite and pretty.) [6] X Research source
